item.title: Four days in Copenhagen
item.description: Executive Summary Overview The purpose of this report is to explore data on AirBnB listings in Copenhagen and understand the key drivers of price variability, specifically focused on the price for a 4-night stay for 2 guests. The Problem What is the best model to predict overall price of AirBnB accommodation in Copenhagen for 2 people wishing to spend 4 nights in the city?

item.title: Mask Acceptance
item.description: NYT mask use Github source for data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(url) nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "010… ## $ never <dbl> 0.053, 0.083, 0.067, 0.020, 0.053, 0.031, 0.102, 0.152, 0.… ## $ rarely <dbl> 0.

item.title: Returns of Financial Stocks
item.description: library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(hrbrthemes) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) library(kableExtra) library(ggrepel) library(patchwork) Here is the analysis on Returns of Financial Stock of a select few companies. We utilise the monthly, yearly and daily returns to gauge behaviour of these stock over a fixed period of time. # Read the dataset nyse <- read_csv(here::here("data","nyse.csv")) After loading the New York Stock Exchange Data, Let’s look at the distribution of companies within different sectors.
